factoid: Anna Mikháylovna knows that Count Cyril Vladímirovich is very ill.
Anna Mikháylovna has come to the hall because Count Cyril Vladímirovich is very ill.
Anna Mikháylovna is a relative of Count Cyril Vladímirovich.
Anna Mikháylovna will not disturb Count Cyril Vladímirovich.
Anna Mikháylovna needs to see Prince Vasíli Sergéevich.
Prince Vasíli Sergéevich is staying at the hall.
The hall porter called Princess Drubetskáya to see Prince Vasíli Sergéevich.
The footman was dressed in knee breeches, shoes, and a swallow-tail coat.
The footman ran downstairs and looked over from the halfway landing.
Anna Mikháylovna smoothed the folds of her dyed silk dress before a large Venetian mirror.
Anna Mikháylovna ascended the carpeted stairs in trodden-down shoes.
Anna Mikháylovna said to her son that he promised her.
Anna Mikháylovna stimulated her son by a touch.
The son lowered his eyes and followed Anna Mikháylovna quietly.
The mother and son entered the large hall.
One of the doors in the large hall led to the apartments assigned to Prince Vasíli Sergéevich.
The mother and son were about to ask for directions from an elderly footman.
The bronze handle of a door turned and Prince Vasíli Sergéevich emerged.
Prince Vasíli Sergéevich was wearing a velvet coat with a single star on his breast.
Prince Vasíli Sergéevich took leave of Lorrain, a celebrated Petersburg doctor.
Lorrain is a celebrated Petersburg doctor.
Prince Vasíli Sergéevich asked, "Then it is certain?"
Lorrain replied, "Prince, humanum est errare, but…"
Lorrain swallowed his r’s and pronounced Latin words with a French accent.
Prince Vasíli Sergéevich dismissed Lorrain with a bow.
Prince Vasíli Sergéevich approached Anna Mikháylovna and her son silently and with a look of inquiry.
The son noticed an expression of profound sorrow clouding Anna Mikháylovna’s face.
The son smiled slightly.
Anna Mikháylovna said, "Ah, Prince! In what sad circumstances we meet again! And how is our dear invalid?"
Anna Mikháylovna was unaware of the cold offensive look fixed on her.
Prince Vasíli Sergéevich stared at Anna Mikháylovna and at Borís questioningly and perplexed.
Borís bowed politely.
Prince Vasíli Sergéevich turned to Anna Mikháylovna without acknowledging the bow.
Prince Vasíli Sergéevich answered Anna Mikháylovna’s query with a movement of his head and lips indicating very little hope for the patient.
Anna Mikháylovna exclaimed, "Is it possible?"
Anna Mikháylovna said, "Oh, how awful! It is terrible to think."
Anna Mikháylovna said, "This is my son."
Anna Mikháylovna indicated Borís.
Anna Mikháylovna said, "He wanted to thank you himself."
Borís bowed again politely.
Anna Mikháylovna said, "Believe me, Prince, a mother’s heart will never forget what you have done for us."
Prince Vasíli Sergéevich said, "I am glad I was able to do you a service, my dear Anna Mikháylovna."
Prince Vasíli Sergéevich arranged his lace frill.
Prince Vasíli Sergéevich was in Moscow to Anna Mikháylovna.
Prince Vasíli Sergéevich had placed Anna Mikháylovna under an obligation.
Prince Vasíli Sergéevich assumed an air of much greater importance than he had done in Petersburg at Anna Schérer’s reception.
Prince Vasíli Sergéevich told Borís, "Try to serve well and show yourself worthy."
Prince Vasíli Sergéevich told Borís, "I am glad."
Prince Vasíli Sergéevich asked Borís, "Are you here on leave?"
Prince Vasíli Sergéevich spoke in his usual tone of indifference.
Borís replied, "I am awaiting orders to join my new regiment, your excellency."
Borís betrayed neither annoyance at Prince Vasíli’s brusque manner nor a desire to enter into conversation.
Borís spoke so quietly and respectfully that Prince Vasíli gave him a searching glance.
Borís asked, "Are you living with your mother?"
Borís replied, "I am living at Countess Rostóva’s."
Borís again added, "your excellency."
Anna Mikháylovna said, "That is, with Ilyá Rostóv who married Nataly Shinshiná."
Prince Vasíli Sergéevich answered, "I know, I know."
Anna Mikháylovna said, "I never could understand how Nataly made up her mind to marry that unlicked bear!"
Anna Mikháylovna said, "A perfectly absurd and stupid fellow, and a gambler too, I am told."
Count Cyril Vladímirovich is a count.
Prince Vasíli Sergéevich is a prince.
Princess Drubetskáya is a princess.
Countess Rostóva is a countess.
Anna Mikháylovna is the mother of Borís.
Borís is the son of Anna Mikháylovna.
